description.narrative: By 2016 the Dominican Republic has an established national policy for the prevention of violence against children in accordance with international human rights treaties and the recommendations of the UN Secretary General's Study on Violence against Children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016 the Dominican Republic has an established national policy for the prevention of violence against children in accordance with international human rights treaties and the recommendations of the UN Secretary General’s Study on Violence against Children.

description.narrative: The Government's capacity and coordination to prosecute the online child pornography was improved with clear results. The National Roadmap for the Elimination of Violence against Children was extended until 2020, and a system for monitoring compliance was established. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/12/2017
